long_desc.thetext:
Description of problem: spatialite-tools requires sqlite = 3.11.0, preventing sqlite upgrade
Version-Release number of selected component (if applicable): spatialite-tools-4.3.0-9.fc24
How reproducible: readily
Steps to Reproduce: 1. install spatialite-tools and old sqlite-3.11.0-3.fc24 (if you can find it) 2. dnf upgrade --best
Actual results: Error: package spatialite-tools-4.3.0-9.fc24.x86_64 requires sqlite = 3.11.0, but none of the providers can be installed.
Expected results: upgrades sqlite
Additional info: It looks like libspatialite & spatialite-gui just require libsqlite3.so.0(), so this shouldn't bite them too.
And it's just been bumped to sqlite-3.13.0. Speaking of bumps…

Created attachment 1184291 Removes explicit sqlite version builddep from spatialite-tools spec file
Bugzilla 1048587 explains why these rebuilds were necessary. Briefly: """ a problem exists, but it's strictly confined to the spatialite.c source alone ... the spatialite CLI front-end simply is a direct derivative of the original sqlite3 front-end ... unhappily, the sqlite3 own code internally includes somewhere a formal check ensuring that the dynamically loaded .so should exactly correspond to the same version declared by the header file used at compile time. ... any other tool (e.g. spatialite_osm_map or spatialite_gui) seems to be completely immune from this issue ... I imagine that spatialite-tools 4.2 will surely be the last version including the spatialite CLI frontent, and starting since 4.3 this component should be definitely removed from spatialite-tools. """ So the builddep for a particular version of sqlite was necessary to support building spatialite.c, and spatialite.c is no longer part of spatialite-tools 4.3.0.
I’ve verified that spatialite.c isn't in the current source, and rebuilt spatialite-tools without checking for an exact sqlite version (spec file patch is attached). /usr/bin/spatialite runs without complaint, so it seems like this is a safe change to make to the package going forward:
